meanings.definition: The state of touching or meeting at a point
meanings.sent1: The tangences of the two circles occurred at a single point.
meanings.sent2: The tangences of the lines on the graph showed where they met.
meanings.sent3: The tangences of the puzzle pieces made it easy to connect them.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship had tangences with shared interests and experiences.
meanings.sent5: The tangences of the dance partners created a seamless performance.

meanings.sent1: At the tangences of the roads, the traffic flow was controlled.
meanings.sent2: The tangences of the wires caused a short circuit.
meanings.sent3: The tangences of the cat's paws on the keyboard amused the owner.
meanings.sent4: Their ideas had tangences that sparked a creative collaboration.
meanings.sent5: The tangences of the brush strokes created a beautiful painting.
